channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Dealing with Iran's nuclear program requires tricky diplomacy. But there's low trust
item.description: President Trump says U.S. and Israeli forces destroyed Iran's nuclear program. Analysts say Iran may have moved its uranium stockpiles. There's little trust, by all sides, in diplomacy.

item.title: South Africa's cricket and rugby teams help unite a nation with a complicated legacy
item.description: South Africa's cricket and rugby teams have reached top spots in their sports under the leadership of Black captains. Fans are united in a nation still grappling with the legacy of racial division.

item.title: Want to own Napoleon's hat? Some of his belongings are being auctioned
item.description: Sotheby's in Paris is actioning off a collection of relics from Napoleon's private world, including rings, a travel throne and one of his iconic bicorn hats.

item.title: Remembering R&B singer Cavin Yarbrough
item.description: One of the leading voices of early 1980s R&B, Cavin Yarbrough, of the singing duo Yarbrough and Peoples, passed away at the age of 71.

item.title: Why no is one panicking about oil, despite a war in the Middle East
item.description: Global crude oil prices have eased. Markets are betting that protracted conflict is unlikely. meanwhile, domestic production has helped insulate the U.S. from global price shocks.

item.title: Senator shares early intelligence on state of Iranian nuclear program
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Virginia Sen. Mark Warner is the leading Democrat on the Senate intelligence committee, about the assessment of Iran's nuclear program following the U.S. attack.

item.title: Trump said he wants to send 30,000 immigrants to Gitmo. It's ready for a few hundred
item.description: What's the current status of the Trump administration's vow to send 30K migrants to Gitmo?

item.title: Oklahoma City holds parade for NBA champs OKC Thunder
item.description: For Oklahoma City, winning the NBA championship was a really big deal. It was the first time the Thunder won it all and the city celebrated Tuesday with a parade.

item.title: Even bridal gowns fall victim to tariffs
item.description: Tariffs have entered the bridal fitting room as couples are discovering that almost all the dresses are made abroad. Many are designed in the U.S. and made in China.

item.title: Trump billed himself as a peacemaker, but 3 separate conflicts tell a different story
item.description: Over the past five months, President Trump has become directly involved in three separate conflicts, but so far, his record is mixed at best.
